title: Exam: Project Management Fundamentals
description: Assessment of project management terminology and future tense accuracy.

items.explanation: KPI stands for Key Performance Indicator, a quantifiable measure of success.
items.prompt: What does 'KPI' stand for in project management?

items.explanation: Future Continuous (Will be + -ing).
items.prompt: This time next week, the development team ________ (test) the new software.

items.explanation: The standard sequence is Initiation, Planning, Execution, and finally Closure.
items.prompt: What is the correct order of the four project phases?

items.explanation: Future Perfect (Will have + past participle).

items.explanation: Scope creep refers to adding requirements without increasing resources or time.
items.prompt: Which of the following defines 'Scope Creep'?

items.explanation: Agile is an iterative methodology that uses short cycles called sprints.
items.prompt: Which methodology is characterized by iterative 'Sprints'?

items.explanation: Future Perfect Continuous shows duration up to a point in the future.

To fire employees at the end of a project
items.explanation: A project charter formally authorizes the project and defines its high-level scope.

items.explanation: To 'fall behind' means to be late according to the schedule.

items.explanation: To 'sign off on' means to give final approval.
items.prompt: The director must ________ ________ on the deliverables before we can close the project.

items.explanation: A Post-Mortem is an analysis of a project after its completion.
items.prompt: What is the term for a meeting held after a project to review success and failures?

items.explanation: SMART stands for Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound.
items.prompt: What does the 'SMART' acronym stand for in goal setting?

items.explanation: Future Continuous for an action in progress.
items.prompt: Tomorrow at this time, I ________ ________ ________ (deliver) the training session.

options: A bar chart showing a project schedule
items.explanation: A Gantt chart is a standard tool for visualizing a project timeline.

items.explanation: Waterfall is a linear, sequential approach where one phase must end before the next starts.
items.prompt: Which methodology is best described as a linear, sequential approach?

items.explanation: Future Perfect for a deadline.
items.prompt: I'm sure that by the end of the day, the team ________ ________ ________ (resolve) the bottleneck.
